conclusion: A drives into a group of blocks and determines which blocks it will collide with and where it will eventually stop.
The image shows a green mat with various colored blocks arranged in clusters. A car labeled 'A' is approaching from the right side.
There is a stack of orange and red blocks in the upper-right area, with a small red block in the front row.
A lone small yellow block is positioned in the lower-center area of the mat.
There are other blocks, including green, blue, and yellow blocks, arranged in clusters on the mat.
A first strikes the small red block in the front row of the orange-and-red stack.
The impact with the red block deflects A slightly leftward and slows it.
After being deflected, A's right side clips the small yellow block sitting by itself in front.
After the two contacts, A's remaining kinetic energy is low, and it rolls a short distance.
A comes to rest just beyond the lone yellow block, roughly in the lower-center part of the mat.
The initial hit on the red block absorbs most of A's momentum and alters its direction.
The second graze with the yellow block removes the rest of A's motion, leaving it stopped near the two blocks.
